It starts off as a genre I am NEVER interested in, puzzle. Yet it's the super duper high level quality writing, the pixar like animation and the immense art direction which carried me to the end. Yeah, my brain turned off at times because the puzzles YOU ACTUALLY HAD TO THINK ABOUT but the story won out and had me playing a game I would never otherwise give 'the time' of day too. It's depessingly rare for a game to have a genuine, hilarious sense of houmour, much less any humour, Valve has pulled that off ipeccably which results in a game that will stick with you long after the decent, but kinda 'eh' ending tuned has played. Souce being older then justin Bieber, outputs an amazing looking game that proves again and again that strong art is better then shiny new shaders. Though Portal 2 has a few new ones for the more whorish. :P

 I do care for HL, Valve though, has yet proved again they  never 'bang rocks together'.  Buy the game, you'll get 60 bucks! ;)

A robot leaves Anor Londo for Detroit, 2027. He is confused. He has clearly come to the wrong goddamn place again. Where is he going to put this cube. He hurls it in frustration, and has accidentally killed a guard. He fires another portal, and takes a vending machine for replacement. It's bound to hold down the button just as well, or whatever the cube was going to do.

Dr. P-Beckett never returned home.

When Portal was released, it was a wonderous title that showed us what it meant to think in portals (and that the cake is a lie). As a game, it was really short and perhaps a bit repetetive, but it was an introduction to what was to come; Portal 2. In this direct sequel to Portal, everything is bigger and better! This is no longer a tech demo, this is a game. The story (which I won't divulge any more of here) goes deeper than Portal and the levels are more complex, with light bridges, gels with different properties and tractor beams involved. Portal 2 is definitely a feelgood-game in the sense, that when you complete a testchamber, you feel good and smart! And it's got two player co-op mode.

Одна из лучших игр современности и один из лучших игровых сиквелов. Как Half-Life 2 на голову лучше Half-Life, так и Portal 2 уделывает своего предшественника. Разнооборазие загадок, интереснейший сюжет, отличный юмор, бездна юмора и веселья, замечательный кооператив, и душещипательная концовка - стопроцентный musthave!
Мне очень нравится Portal 2 и я надеюсь, что это еще не конец. Я определенно надеюсь, что 3-я часть все же выйдет.

Безумно интересная даже в 4ый раз. Для интересного кооператива нужен действительно умелый напарник. Пройти их -  одно дело, стать лучшими или, хотя бы, "прокачанными"  в плане результатов "время/порталы" - другое)

[h1]Great puzzles, great characters, great writing![/h1]

[b][i]Portal 2[/i] is the 2nd game in the Portal series, which is a spin-off of the Half-Life series. It's a first-person shooter puzzle game where you use your gun to make portals and solve physics puzzles. It continues the story of the first game and takes place in the abandoned and decaying Aperture Science Laboratories. You accidentally revive the AI GLaDOS, who is not very happy that you brutally murdered her. Mandatory testing ensues.[/b]

Portal 2 is one of my favorite games of all time. Every single aspect of the first Portal is turned up to 11 here. The graphics, puzzles, and music are all much higher quality than in the previous game, and the game is about 5 times longer too (depending on how smart you are). Great new additions include grand action set-pieces, new puzzle elements, and multiple characters. GLaDOS is back, and she's free to be her petty, abusive self from the get go. One of the new characters, Wheatley, also takes the spotlight as your talkative traveling companion who isn't the brightest, but provides hilarious commentary. The writing in this game really is its strong point, but the whole experience is vastly improved. There's still the issue of replay value, but the story is good enough to look past.

Also included is a co-op campaign, which isn't as good as the main game, but it's still a lot of fun if your partner knows what they're doing.

I wholeheartedly recommend this game to anybody and everybody. You don't even need to play the first game to enjoy it. It's a must-have.

[h1]Overall Enjoyment:
5/5 — Fantastic[/h1]

The best game of 2011. If you haven't played this through, do it. It is a worthy sequel of Portal, adding awesome mechanics and beautiful puzzles. The plot is genius, and one can see references to and inspiration from other great futuristic works. The soundtrack is just as great the hundredth time as it was the first time. The only problem with this game is that it's linear. There is not much exploration to be done once you played it through once or twice.

Looking forward to what these guys are gonna come up with next. I'm liking the futuristic dystopian titles a lot.
If you are looking for something different, or that will challenge your problem solving skills, don't think twice about Portal 2.  Just GET IT.  You won't have any regrets.

What more can be said about Portal 2 that already hasnt been said? The game takes a simple concept, and reshapes it into a challenging puzzler that will sure to make your brain cramp. You are a tester at Aperature Sciences. You have awoken from a deep sleep, and immediatley find yourself solving puzzles in order to escape the evil computer, GLADOS, who wants to make your life a living hell. You are also joined by a little robot friend with hilarious dialogue who assists you on your journey. The dialogue within  this game is what makes it a sheer masterpiece. You are constantly called fat, ungly, and a bastard, in the literal sense, on a hourly basis, perhaps, forcing you to question whether you are what the game paints you as. I mean, the dialogue is top notch, better than GTA in my opinion. Anyway, I digress. What puts the icing on the nonexistent cake are the NUMEROUS puzzles. The learning curve is perfect, and you dont feel codled and taken care of. All in all, this game is a masterpiece, one I would put above GTA and TLOU any day.

Beautiful, funny, warm.  An excellent interactive experience, all around.  Puzzles were challenging - the game seems nice and long for the first play-through.  Then come the tense moments, the feeling of urgency - this game will get your heart racing at times, yet other times you'll feel that you can sit and ponder a solution to a complicated puzzle.  Excellent in every regard - writing, sound, music, story, graphical beauty, gameplay, difficulty...  Ten out of ten.

I bought Portal 2 with completely reversed expectations, given my feelings regarding the first one I thought I wouldn't care about the single-player aspect and would soley focus on the coop. How wrong was I. Portal 2 in my opinion completely trumps the previous one in terms of gameplay, humor and appearance as well as story. The addition of the Wheatley character, Cave Johnson's mad ramblings and insight of GL@DoS' origins learned while cooperating with her makes for a far more gripping story than "do crap, get cake". While I was rather dissapointed with the coop mode for it's repetitive and tiring nature it doesn't mean that it's completely overshadowed by the single player portion, while it lacks a certain appeal it's simplisticly lovable and somewhat childish characters and plot bring something different to the table that's worth a taste. In summary, I loved Portal 2 so much more than Portal, even if it completely overshoots the modest charm that Portal has.
I haven't laughed so much while playing a game in a very long time... well worth playing!
